So the chance that Rebecca buys lilies one week, given that she bought roses the previous week is 31.

questions.question_text: What is the exact probability that she buys lilies on the fifth Saturday?
questions.detailed_answer: The fifth Saturday means that there will be four transitions. The probabilities will be [431 1 53 22 0 53] Using CAS, this gives [7717.16 875] So, in 4 weeks’ time, the probability that Rebecca buys lilies is 7717.16 875

questions.question_text: Find the value of k, where 8k< , such that the probability of each flower type lasting longer than k days is the same, correct to 2 decimal places. State the value of k, correct to 2 decimal places.
questions.detailed_answer: For the probabilities to be equal, 121(12 ) normCDf ( , 100000, 1, 7.2)288ktt d t k σμ −= = ==∫. Check whether to let k = 7.77 or 7.76. If 7.77k= then correct to 2 decimal places the integral probability is 0.29, whereas the normal distribution probability is 0.28 (so the two are not equal at the 2 decimal places level). However if 7.76k= , the integral probability gives 0.29 and the normal distribution probability gives 0.29 (correct to 2 decimal places) and so they are equal. So, k = 7.76.
